bug.author: yashrajjain726
bug.summary: There is no defined version as defined in Tensorflow website
bug.description:
<denchmark-link:https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/53373012/96131702-28e9af80-0f17-11eb-8791-d915f4c3d1c1.jpg></denchmark-link>
<denchmark-link:https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/53373012/96131712-2b4c0980-0f17-11eb-83ae-33c159b83228.png></denchmark-link>
Ohk, So as defined in the tensorflow gpu documentation, the tensorflow 2.3 can have a cuda version of 10.1 and cuDNN version of 7.4. But there isn't any cuDNN v7.4 for CUDA 10.1, according to the nvidia cuDNN archives. So, please update the version of cuDNN in your documentation, to the specified CUDA and Tensorflow version. <denchmark-h:h2>URL(s) with the issue:</denchmark-h>
Link to the tensorflow gpu section: <denchmark-link:https://www.tensorflow.org/install/source_windows#gpu>https://www.tensorflow.org/install/source_windows#gpu</denchmark-link>

comments.comment: It should be 7.6, not 7.4. Will fix the typo
Edit: Note that Linux is properly updated: <denchmark-link:https://www.tensorflow.org/install/source#ubuntu>https://www.tensorflow.org/install/source#ubuntu</denchmark-link>
Should be fixed by above PR
